content: Minor point with respect to seasonality, I should have mentioned in answering Doug's question about SaaS, that among the things we're seeing that we didn't expect is that FaaS does not -- has not been exhibiting seasonal characteristics of the rest of the business. Your line is now open. Thank you, Barry, thank you, Liz. Your line is now open. Thank you, Barry, thank you, Liz. Your line is now open. We could hear -- let's say 300 units a day and decide we're not selling anymore in a particular day, and we just take it down from the web so that  can't order any more parts in any particular day or week or month or quarter, by way of example. Your line is now open. Your line is now open. Your line is now open. But we should be beneficiaries of increased word of mouth as the unaided brand awareness grows, particularly in North America and because of the growth in recurring subscription revenue, offset by growth in new markets and in new product categories that have relatively low growth like the digital app because last time I looked, I'm not sure what it is today, it was 4% unaided brand awareness. Your line is now open. Your line is now open.
